Job Position: ERP Data Entry Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations / Finance / ERP &amp; MIS
Reports To: ERP Administrator / Operations Manager / Finance Manager

	Role Purpose: Ensure accurate, timely, and compliant entry of business data into the ERP system
	Business Impact: Supports data integrity, operational efficiency, reporting accuracy, and audit readiness
	Industry Context: Trading / Automotive / Tyres / FMCG / Logistics.


Key Responsibilities &ndash; ERP Data Entry &amp; Transactions


	Sales &amp; Receipts: Enter sales invoices, receipts, and credit notes
	Procurement: Enter purchase orders, vendor bills, and supplier payments
	Inventory: Record GRNs, stock issues, transfers, and adjustments
	Expenses &amp; Assets: Enter expenses, service entries, and fixed asset records
	Documentation: Attach invoices, waybills, delivery notes, and GRNs.


Inventory &amp; Operations Support:


	Stock Records: Maintain accurate stock records for tyres, tubes, rims, and accessories
	Item Master: Update item codes, pricing, warehouses, and locations
	Stock Control: Support stock counts, reconciliations, and variance analysis.


Data Accuracy &amp; Control:


	Verification: Review source documents for completeness and correctness
	Error Control: Cross-check ERP entries and correct discrepancies
	Escalation: Report missing approvals or abnormal entries.


Finance &amp; Compliance Support:


	Tax Classification: Assist with VAT and WHT tagging
	Accounting Support: Ensure correct ledger and cost center posting
	Compliance: Maintain ERP records for audits and regulatory needs.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Reporting: Generate ERP reports for sales, purchases, inventory, expenses
	Filing: Maintain electronic and physical records
	Audit Support: Provide ERP data during audits.


Process Discipline &amp; Improvement:


	SOP Compliance
	System Issues
	Report ERP errors and access limitations
	Improvement
	Suggest process improvements.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Data Accuracy
	Error-free ERP entries
	Timeliness
	On-time posting
	Reconciliation
	Accurate stock and ledger balances
	Compliance
	Adherence to ERP workflows
	Audit Support
	Timely data availability.


Requirements


	Minimum Qualification (OND / HND / B.Sc.) in relevant Fields e.g. Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, or related.
	Experience Level: 1 &ndash; 3 years
	ERP data entry, accounting, inventory or operations support
	ERP Exposure
	Hands-on ERP experience (mandatory).


Additional / Preferred Requirements:


	Local Knowledge
	Tax Awareness
	Basic understanding of VAT and WHT
	Availability
	Willingness to work Saturdays.


Technical Skills:


	ERP Systems
	Accounting Knowledge
	Inventory Knowledge
	MS Excel.


Core Competencies:


	Accuracy
	Numerical Ability
	Time Management
	Integrity
	Confidential data handling
	Pressure Handling
	Works well in fast-paced environments.


Soft Skills:


	Communication
	Clear written and verbal communication
	Teamwork
	Collaborative approach
	Learning Ability
	Willingness to learn
	Problem Solving
	Proactive mindset.


Work Schedule &amp; Compensation:


	Work Days: Monday &ndash; Friday
	Work Hours: (Weekdays) - 8:30 AM &ndash; 6:00 PM
	Saturday: 8:30 AM &ndash; 3:00 PM.


Benefits


	Salary:&nbsp;N150,000 per month
	Incentives: Quarterly performance-based incentives
	Statutory benefits as per company policy.


Method of Application:

Founded 40 years ago, Infinity Group has established itself as the most preferred company for automotive aftermarket products in Nigeria. The group has expanded its footprint into Ghana and has taken a leadership position in the West African region, for tyres, batteries, lubricants, spare parts and coolants. The group services its customers through a vast network of retail sales & service centers across Nigeria & Ghana.

Job Position: ERP Data Entry Executive
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations / Finance / ERP & MIS
Reports To: ERP Administrator / Operations Manager / Finance Manager

	Procurement: Enter purchase orders, vendor bills, and supplier payments
	Inventory: Record GRNs, stock issues, transfers, and adjustments
	Expenses & Assets: Enter expenses, service entries, and fixed asset records
	Documentation: Attach invoices, waybills, delivery notes, and GRNs.


Inventory & Operations Support:


	Stock Records: Maintain accurate stock records for tyres, tubes, rims, and accessories
	Item Master: Update item codes, pricing, warehouses, and locations
	Stock Control: Support stock counts, reconciliations, and variance analysis.


Data Accuracy & Control:


	Verification: Review source documents for completeness and correctness
	Error Control: Cross-check ERP entries and correct discrepancies
	Escalation: Report missing approvals or abnormal entries.


Finance & Compliance Support:


	Tax Classification: Assist with VAT and WHT tagging
	Accounting Support: Ensure correct ledger and cost center posting
	Compliance: Maintain ERP records for audits and regulatory needs.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Reporting: Generate ERP reports for sales, purchases, inventory, expenses
	Filing: Maintain electronic and physical records
	Audit Support: Provide ERP data during audits.

	SOP Compliance
	System Issues
	Report ERP errors and access limitations
	Improvement
	Suggest process improvements.

	Data Accuracy
	Error-free ERP entries
	Timeliness
	On-time posting
	Reconciliation
	Accurate stock and ledger balances
	Compliance
	Adherence to ERP workflows
	Audit Support
	Timely data availability.


Requirements


	Minimum Qualification (OND / HND / B.Sc.) in relevant Fields e.g. Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, or related.
	Experience Level: 1 – 3 years
	ERP data entry, accounting, inventory or operations support
	ERP Exposure
	Hands-on ERP experience (mandatory).


Additional / Preferred Requirements:


	Local Knowledge
	Tax Awareness
	Basic understanding of VAT and WHT
	Availability
	Willingness to work Saturdays.


Technical Skills:


	ERP Systems
	Accounting Knowledge
	Inventory Knowledge
	MS Excel.


Core Competencies:


	Accuracy
	Numerical Ability
	Time Management
	Integrity
	Confidential data handling
	Pressure Handling
	Works well in fast-paced environments.


Soft Skills:


	Communication
	Clear written and verbal communication
	Teamwork
	Collaborative approach
	Learning Ability
	Willingness to learn
	Problem Solving
	Proactive mindset.


Work Schedule & Compensation:


	Work Days: Monday – Friday
	Work Hours: (Weekdays) - 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM
	Saturday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM.


Benefits


	Salary: N150,000 per month
	Incentives: Quarterly performance-based incentives
	Statutory benefits as per company policy.

Interested and qualified candidates should submit their updated CV / Resume to: hrss@infinitytyres.com or Jobs@infinitytyres.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.
